did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Robert D. Farquhar Architectural Drawings,

did.physloc: Stored off-site at SRLF. Advance notice is required for access to the collection. Please contact the UCLA Library, Department of Special Collections Reference Desk for paging information.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: COLLECTION STORED OFF-SITE AT SRLF: Advance notice required for access.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical object belong to the UCLA Library, Department of Special Collections. Literary rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Robert D. Farquhar Architectural Drawings (Collection 1579). Department of Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of architectural drawings, blueprints, sketches, and plans of Robert D. Farquhar, and one photograph of Bourgeois, Arthur Brown's collaborator for the San Francisco Hall. Includes drawings for Florence Brown residence in Bel Air (Los Angeles), Mrs. Henry Weyse residence in Santa Monica, Mr. and Mrs. Charles Quinn residence in Holmby Hills (Los Angeles), and the Harvey Mudd and Richard Rogers residence in Beverly Hills.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.

did.unittitle: Florence Brown residence. Bel air - drawings.
Ada McCormick's father's house. Idaho - drawings.
Mr. and mrs. James Whittlesey residence, La Jolla.
Haynes - stairs details, rooms.
Ellis [?] Jones residence, L.S. - sketches and floor plans.
Mrs. Henry Weyse residence, Santa Monica - drawings.
House in perspective - RDF.
Mr. and Mrs. Charles Quinn residence, Holmby Hills.
W.L. Garland residence, little cocktail room drawings, blueprints.
Francis Farquhar residence and book cases - sketches and plans.
Titcomb - miscellaneous sketches.
Mr. and Mrs. Ben Stroud residence, Huntington Palisades, Santa Monica.
Titcomb's drawings for California Club and sketches for living room.
381 California Terrace, Pasadena. Roland Coates, architect, bought by RDF 1929, sold 1950.
Quinn house, 1936, porch addition, west porch - prints. Quality sheet metal.
Miss T.H. Graham residence, Sierra Madre - drawings.
Greek church[?].
Colin Farquhar: Hunter's Creek - mill house. Colin's Mill house.
Mrs. Quinn's collection - urns, vases, etc.

note.p: "Not done, too costly for heirs, about $10,000 for cases. Gift to USC. USC room Mrs. Quinn's pottery."

did.unittitle: Danziger residence, Los Angeles - cloth blue prints.
Pembery drawings from England for Quinn Room, Huntington Library - drawings and blue prints. 4 rolls.
Harvey Mudd residence, Beverly Hills - drawings for mantel.
Treanor - front door.
Studio - Browning Building, Waco University.
Mrs. Fudger.
Pentagon.
Studio for Alice Lewisohn Crowley at "Crossroads", Ossining, New York.
House for Mrs. Wesley C. Mitchell. Stamford, Connecticut.
The Mill. Hunter's Creek, Walter P. Lewisohn.
[Richard] I. Rogers residence, Beverly Hills.
Quinn - new front iron porch.
Tippet house, Del Mar - drawings. Tippet garden arbor.
Marion Macneil Smith residence, Azusa - drawings.
Photograph of Bourgeois, Arthur Brown's collaborator for the San Francisco Hall, etc.
